_source.text: 70. Tiberius was deeply devoted to Greek and Latin literature and, while still a young man, modelled his Latin oratorical style on that of old Messala Corvinus; but ruined it with so many affectations and pedantries that his extempore speeches were considered far better than the prepared ones.

text: affectations and pedantries that his extempore speeches were considered far **better** **than** the prepared ones.
